1.instruction: Create a complete, well-thought-out Radio Adamowo project with all necessary files. Requirements: 1) Keep the original sophisticated design but make it SLIGHTLY more calm/peaceful (not a complete redesign), 2) Prioritize music player at the top as main feature, 3) Keep all existing functionality including i18n system, manipulation detection, interactive elements, 4) Provide ALL necessary files: index.html, style.css, script.js, playlist.json, language files (pl.json, en.json, nl.json), manifest.json, service worker, 5) Ensure the design is only subtly calmer - softer colors, less aggressive reds, warmer tones, but maintain the sophisticated dark theme and all visual elements, 6) Keep the radio tower/mast branding concept, 7) Maintain all educational content and interactive features. This should be a refined version of what we built, not a complete overhaul.

2.instruction: Review the complete Radio Adamowo project from your perspective as Product Manager. Evaluate: 1) User experience flow and prioritization of music functionality, 2) Content organization and accessibility, 3) Educational value and manipulation detection features, 4) Market positioning and competitive analysis, 5) Internationalization coverage and cultural adaptation, 6) Overall product coherence and user journey. Provide detailed feedback on what works well and what could be improved. Consider if the project meets user needs for both music listening and educational content about manipulation.

3.instruction: Review the Radio Adamowo project architecture from your perspective as System Architect. Evaluate: 1) Code structure and organization in script.js, 2) CSS architecture and maintainability in style.css, 3) HTML semantic structure and accessibility, 4) File organization and project structure, 5) Performance considerations and optimization opportunities, 6) Scalability and extensibility of the codebase, 7) Integration between components (i18n, audio player, manipulation detection), 8) Technical implementation quality and best practices. Provide architectural assessment and recommendations.

4.instruction: Review the Radio Adamowo project from your perspective as Engineer. Evaluate: 1) Code quality and implementation in all files, 2) Functionality testing and user interaction flows, 3) Cross-browser compatibility and responsive design, 4) Performance optimization and loading times, 5) Error handling and edge cases, 6) PWA features and offline capabilities, 7) Audio player functionality and playlist management, 8) JavaScript functionality and event handling, 9) Any missing features or incomplete implementations, 10) Overall technical execution quality. Provide engineering assessment and identify any issues or improvements needed.

5.instruction: Review the Radio Adamowo project from your perspective as Data Analyst. Evaluate: 1) Data structure and organization in playlist.json and language files, 2) Analytics and tracking implementation potential, 3) User behavior tracking and manipulation detection data, 4) Content categorization and metadata quality, 5) Internationalization data completeness and accuracy, 6) Performance metrics and optimization opportunities, 7) Data-driven features and their implementation, 8) Missing data elements or analytics opportunities. Provide data analysis perspective and recommendations for data-driven improvements.

6.instruction: Review the Radio Adamowo project from your perspective as Deep Researcher. Evaluate: 1) Educational content depth and accuracy about manipulation techniques, 2) Psychological concepts implementation and authenticity, 3) Research-based features and their scientific grounding, 4) Content comprehensiveness and educational value, 5) Cultural sensitivity and adaptation across languages, 6) Missing research opportunities or educational gaps, 7) Evidence-based design decisions and their effectiveness, 8) Overall educational impact and learning outcomes. Provide research-based assessment and recommendations for content enhancement.
